title: VR-Based Language Education Design Applying Merrill’s First Principles of Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic proficiency in computer and VR device usage
context.additional_context: Implementation of simulation/VR environments applying Merrill's First Principles of Instruction using open-standard modular software components

learning_goals: Learners can demonstrate language expression skills by applying Merrill’s instructional interaction stages (present real-world problems, analyze requirements, explain core principles, guide performance, provide feedback) in VR environments.
Learners understand XML-based tagging systems and can modularly organize language content for VR scenarios.

Learners can perform team project-based assessments (3-person teams) in a BYOD environment, design two or more communication strategies applicable to three real-world language use scenarios (e.g., business meetings, customer service), and achieve an average score of 3.5 or higher on a 5-point scale in peer and instructor evaluations, with supporting documentation.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
